quote-text: I don’t know if it’s just me that’s not ready to let you die, or if I’m right in thinking you’re not completely ready to leave yet. After Erjie told me that you’d gotten up to give her a wet little nose-nudge the night she came home from the airport, somehow I felt like it wasn’t time yet. That you’ve got a couple of laps left to run, a couple of days left to chill out with the people you’ve known all your life since you were a tiny, wriggling pup, that you’ve still got a few more nose-nudges left in you yet. Ma says you’re such a stubborn old chap that you still act like you can do all these things you can’t, like walk, and they end up having to carry you back into the house. You’re such a stubborn old chap that I want to let you fight on for a bit, and leave only when you’re ready to give up. You silly, stubborn old chap, we’re all probably going to give in long before you give up, and let you go to a better place rather than have you get any worse.
quote-source: Cui, How (and When) To Say Goodbye To Your Dog
